pages.title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets
pages.meta_description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight.

h2: Celebrating the stories that craft tells.

pages.content: Title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets Description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## Celebrating the stories that craft tells. ## November 12–16, 2025 | Alys Beach, Florida ## A Weekend to Savor ## Signature Experiences ## Schedule ## With Gratitude to Our Sponsors ## Supporting the Arts ## CRAFTED ### Firkin Fête ### Holiday Makers Market ### Spirited Soirée ### Pickleball & Picklebacks Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. From lively tastings to thoughtful markets, Crafted offers a collection of unforgettable gatherings. Explore these featured events and discover your favorites. An intimate tasting event featuring rare firkin cask ales, craft brews, and paired bites from local chefs. A curated marketplace of handmade goods, fine crafts, and seasonal gifts from talented artisans. An elevated afternoon of cocktails, live music, and culinary delights along the scenic Pedestrian Path at Alys Beach. A playful morning of friendly competition and briny refreshment—yes, pickleback shots included. Plan your perfect weekend. Whether you're sipping rare spirits, browsing handmade goods, or enjoying the delightful afternoon soiree, each day of Crafted is thoughtfully designed to inspire, delight, and connect. Explore the full lineup of events and start curating your experience. Tuesday, November 11th, 2025 5 PM NEAT Bottle Shop & Tasting Room Wednesday, November 12th, 2025 5:30 PM Red Loggia at Caliza Thursday, November 13th, 2025 5 PM Red Loggia at Caliza 5 PM Fonville Press 5 PM Papilio Park Friday, November 14th, 2025 1 PM North Sea Garden Walk 2 - 4:30 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 6:30 - 9 PM Central Park Saturday, November 15th, 2025 10 AM - 2 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 11 AM Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre 1 PM - 4 PM North Sea Garden Walk Sunday, November 16th, 2025 10 AM - 2 PM Alys Beach Amphitheatre 11 AM Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre 12 - 3 PM Racquet Courts at ZUMA Crafted is made possible through the generous support of our sponsors. These visionary partners share our passion for creativity, culture, and community. We are honored to collaborate with them to bring this unforgettable weekend to life. The Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County has been the creative core of the local community for three decades – 30 years of fostering creativity as a local arts agency in Walton County, Florida. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
original_paragraphs: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight.
From lively tastings to thoughtful markets, Crafted offers a collection of unforgettable gatherings. Explore these featured events and discover your favorites.
An intimate tasting event featuring rare firkin cask ales, craft brews, and paired bites from local chefs.
A curated marketplace of handmade goods, fine crafts, and seasonal gifts from talented artisans.
An elevated afternoon of cocktails, live music, and culinary delights along the scenic Pedestrian Path at Alys Beach.
A playful morning of friendly competition and briny refreshment—yes, pickleback shots included.

Plan your perfect weekend. Whether you're sipping rare spirits, browsing handmade goods, or enjoying the delightful afternoon soiree, each day of Crafted is thoughtfully designed to inspire, delight, and connect. Explore the full lineup of events and start curating your experience.

pages.title: Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles | CRAFTED

h1: Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles
h3: Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre

pages.content: Title: Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles | CRAFTED # Children’s Be the Maker Workshop with Marilu Doodles ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Sunday, November 16, 2025 ### 11 AM ### Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre This special edition of the Be the Maker series is for the kids! While you enjoy exploring the Holiday Makers Market, we invite your children to join artist Marilu Morgan of Marilu Doodles for an Alys Beach Crafted edition of her beloved Craft Club. In this hands-on workshop, young makers will craft their very own custom canvas stocking—perfect for adding a personal touch to their room or seasonal décor. With Marilu’s expert guidance, they will paint and personalize a canvas stocking, embellish with bits and bobbles, and all the while learn simple but foundational design techniques. While your family may already have its set of cherished holiday stockings, this custom keepsake is sure to capture a moment in each child’s artistic expression – their time in Alys Beach, their favorite holiday traditions, or simply their favorite childhood delights. A cheerful, festive, creative experience to commemorate time spent in this special place. This Be the Maker Workshop is limited to ages 5-18. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre – Splash Pad When Sunday, November 16, 2025 | 11AM Age Children ages 5-18 Dress Code Please note this workshop is creative & messy – you may get paint on your clothes. Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Interactive Workshop Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
original_paragraphs: This special edition of the Be the Maker series is for the kids! While you enjoy exploring the Holiday Makers Market, we invite your children to join artist Marilu Morgan of Marilu Doodles for an Alys Beach Crafted edition of her beloved Craft Club. In this hands-on workshop, young makers will craft their very own custom canvas stocking—perfect for adding a personal touch to their room or seasonal décor. With Marilu’s expert guidance, they will paint and personalize a canvas stocking, embellish with bits and bobbles, and all the while learn simple but foundational design techniques.

While your family may already have its set of cherished holiday stockings, this custom keepsake is sure to capture a moment in each child’s artistic expression – their time in Alys Beach, their favorite holiday traditions, or simply their favorite childhood delights. A cheerful, festive, creative experience to commemorate time spent in this special place. This Be the Maker Workshop is limited to ages 5-18.
Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre – Splash Pad

pages.title: Holiday Makers Market Sunday | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Holiday Makers Market Sunday | CRAFTED # Holiday Makers Market ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Sunday, November 16, 2025 ### 10 AM - 2 PM ### Alys Beach Amphitheatre Join us in the Alys Beach Amphitheatre on Friday, November 14, 2025 from 2 – 4:30 pm, Saturday, November 15 from 10 am – 2 pm and Sunday, November 16 from 10 am – 2 pm for the Alys Beach Crafted Holiday Makers Market. This collection of thoughtfully selected artisans will showcase their craft, their inspiration, and their stories with product representing the best in regional workmanship. Guests are invited to stroll through the Amphitheatre in Alys Beach Town Center to peruse the works of these makers, available to purchase and specially curated as gifts for loved ones, for the home, or for oneself, will be available for purchase as folks shop through the Amphitheatre in pursuit of beautifully curated gifts for their loved ones in preparation for the upcoming holidays. Enjoy live music while perusing the Makers Market and enjoy a selection of treats and refreshments available for purchase from surrounding Merchants. Photos with Santa will be available at select times during the Holiday Makers Market. This event is free and open to the public. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre When Sunday, November 16, 2025 | 10AM-2PM Age All ages, and dogs, welcome Dress Code Come as you are! Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Walkable Music Saunders Boyz 10AM-2PM Photos with Santa 12PM-2PM Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A | CRAFTED

h1: Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A
h3: Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre

pages.content: Title: Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A | CRAFTED # Be the Maker Workshop with Sugarbird 30A ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Saturday, November 15, 2025 ### 11 AM ### Splash Pad at the Alys Beach Amphitheatre Join Sugarbird 30A for a beautifully curated Be the Maker workshop, celebrating the delicate, whimsical artistry of pressed florals. With an abundant array of blooms and botanical textures at your fingertips, Sonnie and Emily will walk you through creating your own one-of-a-kind floral composition using the time-honored process of pressing flowers. This intimate gathering invites cheerful creativity and camaraderie, complemented by light bites, refreshments, and thoughtful guidance in technique and design. Each participant will create an 8” X 8” pressed floral arrangement, elegantly framed – an artful keepsake to gift or to grace a special space in your own home. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre – Splash Pad When Saturday, November 15, 2025 | 11AM Age 18 & up Dress Code Please note this workshop is creative & messy – you may get paint on your clothes. Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Interactive Workshop Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Architectural Tour  | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Architectural Tour | CRAFTED # Architectural Tour ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Friday, November 14, 2025 ### 1 PM ### North Sea Garden Walk Walk the pedestrian paths and alleys of Alys Beach with Marieanne Khoury-Vogt, Alys Beach Town Architect and full-time resident of 20+ years alongside husband and partner, Erik Vogt. Marieanne and Erik have shepherded the master planned vision of the town, helping to define a new architectural language informed by the resilience of Bermuda and the classical traditions of the Mediterranean, enhanced by their own inclinations toward Moorish influences and detailing inspired by their travels and connections to different parts of the world. You’re sure to see Alys through new eyes as you learn more about the intentionality behind every detail and hear about the intensely thoughtful planning of the town. Walking through Alys Beach, Marieanne will share the stories behind the craft of architectural design and the shaping of a town that continues to inspire and captivate, imparting fresh insights into what makes Alys so special. Thank you to Christiana Cabinetry for their partnership in sponsoring this year’s Architectural Tour. IMPORTANT INFO Where North Sea Garden Walk (Entrance of Pedestrian Path is on the north side of 30A between the Alys Beach Sales Center & Fonville Press along West La Garza Lane) When Friday, November 14, 2025 | 1PM Age All ages welcome Dress Code Walking Attire Environment Outdoors, Walking Tour Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

You’re sure to see Alys through new eyes as you learn more about the intentionality behind every detail and hear about the intensely thoughtful planning of the town. Walking through Alys Beach, Marieanne will share the stories behind the craft of architectural design and the shaping of a town that continues to inspire and captivate, imparting fresh insights into what makes Alys so special.

pages.title: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary | CRAFTED

h1: Experiential Dinner: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary

pages.content: Title: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary | CRAFTED # Experiential Dinner: Jose Medina Camacho with Heavy Met’l Imports + Alys Beach Culinary ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Thursday, November 13, 2025 ### 5 PM ### Papilio Park Set beneath the stars and the olive trees of Papilio Park, this Experiential Mixology Dinner pairs James Beard Finalist Jose Medina Camacho of Salud Taqueria and Adios Bar (Birmingham, AL) with the tequila and Mexican rums of Heavy Met’l Premium Imports (Austin, TX) alongside the talents of Alys Beach Culinary. Expect a spirited journey through the bold, expressive landscapes of Oaxaca, Jalisco, and beyond as this colorful crew paints a bold, freshly approached, and thoughtfully composed collection of dishes and beverages, connecting us with their stories and inspirations along the way. IMPORTANT INFO Where Papilio Park When Thursday, November 13, 2025 | 5PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Latin Flair Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoor, Seated Dinner Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Brown Foreman and featured Crafted Mixologists + Fonville Press | CRAFTED

h1: Experiential Dinner: Barrels Worth Knowing presented by Brown-Forman + Fonville Press

pages.content: Title: Brown Foreman and featured Crafted Mixologists + Fonville Press | CRAFTED # Experiential Dinner: Barrels Worth Knowing presented by Brown-Forman + Fonville Press ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Thursday, November 13, 2025 ### 5 PM ### Fonville Press Brown-Forman and its premium spirits portfolio will team up with the Fonville Press bar to present a fresh, innovative cocktail experience featuring world-famous brands Jack Daniel’s, Woodford Reserve, Tequila Herradura, and Diplomático Rum. With a multi-course dinner from the talented Fonville Press team, paired with Crafted mixologists' cocktails, guests can settle in for a warm, inspiring evening, showcasing some of Crafted’s most creative and talented personalities. This immersive cocktail dinner promises an elevated night of fun, bringing together a community of shared talent and genuine joy in gathering good people around the table. IMPORTANT INFO Where Fonville Press When Thursday, November 13, 2025 | 5PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Cocktail Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Indoor & Outdoor, Seated Dinner Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum | CRAFTED

h1: Experiential Dinner: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum

pages.content: Title: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum | CRAFTED # Experiential Dinner: Boat Drinks + Worthy Park Estate Rum ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Thursday, November 13, 2025 ### 5 PM ### Red Loggia at Caliza Take a vacation (from your vacation) with this Experiential Dinner presented by Boat Drinks (St. Augustine, FL) and Worthy Park's (Lluidas Vale, Jamaica) award-winning rums. The warm glow of Caliza's Reg Loggia is the tropical evening backdrop to explore the authentic Jamaican rums of Worthy Park, led by Whitney Hobbs (Boat Drinks) and Zan Kong (Worthy Park). You'll learn how to look beyond color and proof to explore the true markers of rum style, flavor and character. Come prepared to challenge the old cliches about rum and discover one of the most diverse spirit categories in the world! Just like in Jamaica, when there is good rum, there is good food. Boat Drink's Captain, Rob Crabtree, will be at the culinary helm to take you on a tour of tropical delights spanning the Caribbean and the Gulf Coast. All the while you'll have frosty, tropical cocktails in hand, and you'll understand why we say "Boat Drinks is a state of mind!” IMPORTANT INFO Where Red Loggia at Caliza When Thursday, November 13, 2025 | 5PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Tropical Cocktail Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Seated Dinner Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
original_paragraphs: Take a vacation (from your vacation) with this Experiential Dinner presented by Boat Drinks (St. Augustine, FL) and Worthy Park's (Lluidas Vale, Jamaica) award-winning rums. The warm glow of Caliza's Reg Loggia is the tropical evening backdrop to explore the authentic Jamaican rums of Worthy Park, led by Whitney Hobbs (Boat Drinks) and Zan Kong (Worthy Park). You'll learn how to look beyond color and proof to explore the true markers of rum style, flavor and character. Come prepared to challenge the old cliches about rum and discover one of the most diverse spirit categories in the world! Just like in Jamaica, when there is good rum, there is good food. Boat Drink's Captain, Rob Crabtree, will be at the culinary helm to take you on a tour of tropical delights spanning the Caribbean and the Gulf Coast. All the while you'll have frosty, tropical cocktails in hand, and you'll understand why we say "Boat Drinks is a state of mind!”

pages.title: Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills | CRAFTED

h1: Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills

pages.content: Title: Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills | CRAFTED # Songwriter Round Table Session with David Ryan Harris + Chris Stills ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Wednesday, November 12, 2025 ### 5:30 PM ### Red Loggia at Caliza In partnership with the beneficiary of Alys Beach Crafted, the Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County (CAA), we are proud to present a new event that pays homage to the CAA’s signature event, the 30A Songwriters Festival. The Songwriters Round Table will feature American singer-songwriters and 30A Songwriters Festival favorites, David Ryan Harris and Chris Stills . Cozy up in the Red Loggia at Caliza and listen to the sweet sounds of two renowned musicians, enjoying the stories behind the lyrics as you experience this intimate showcase. Beverages and light bites will be provided. Thank you to St. Augustine Distillery Co. for their partnership in sponsoring the beverages for this evening. IMPORTANT INFO Where Red Loggia at Caliza When Wednesday, November 12, 2025 | 5:30PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Casual Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Seated Music Alex Rogers , Chris Stills & David Ryan Harris Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. pages.title: Café Brulot Demonstration + The Obituary Cocktail Book Signing with Sue Strachan | CRAFTED

h1: Fired Up at NEAT: A Special Crafted Edition of Wine & Song

pages.content: Title: Café Brulot Demonstration + The Obituary Cocktail Book Signing with Sue Strachan | CRAFTED # Fired Up at NEAT: A Special Crafted Edition of Wine & Song ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Tuesday, November 11, 2025 ### 5 PM ### NEAT Bottle Shop & Tasting Room Legendary New Orleans Cocktails with Author Sue Strachan NEAT | Tuesday, November 11 | 5-7 PM Sue Strachan, author of The Café Brûlot presents her new book, The Obituary Cocktail , with a Café Brulot demonstration. This complimentary event will get the Crafted spirits flowing to kick off the week’s events. Join author Sue Strachan as she shares the stories behind some of New Orleans’ classic cocktails, Café Brûlot and The Obituary Cocktail, while viewing a fiery demonstration of the dramatic Café Brûlot cocktail. The Obituary Cocktail features a blend of gin, vermouth, and absinthe in a spirited honoring of funerary tradition rooted in New Orleans’ clandestine history of “secret societies, second-line parades, and celebrations of deathly holidays like Halloween and All Saints’ Day.” Café Brûlot exemplifies New Orleans’ love for the dramatic with a theatrical presentation that holds as much weight as the libation itself. A concoction of coffee, brandy, sugar, cinnamon, lemon, oranges, cloves and sometimes an orange liqueur, the cocktail is served in a special Brûlot cup and set aflame in a highly ceremonial preparation that requires its own specialty tools and expertise. Born of legend and enduring through the centuries, the old-line restaurants of New Orleans — Antoine’s, Arnaud’s, Brennan’s, Broussard’s, Commander’s Palace and Galatoire’s — continue the tradition of this “devilishly incendiary coffee,” also known as Café Brûlot Diabolique. This special “Crafted” edition of NEAT’s weekly Wine & Song event is complimentary and open to the public with live music and opportunities to purchase The Obituary Cocktail and the Café Brûlot cocktail after the demonstration. Strahan’s books on these legendary cocktails and the New Orleans history and cultural insights around them will be available for purchase, with a book signing from 5-7PM. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
original_paragraphs: Legendary New Orleans Cocktails with Author Sue Strachan

, with a Café Brulot demonstration. This complimentary event will get the Crafted spirits flowing to kick off the week’s events. Join author Sue Strachan as she shares the stories behind some of New Orleans’ classic cocktails, Café Brûlot and The Obituary Cocktail, while viewing a fiery demonstration of the dramatic Café Brûlot cocktail.

The Obituary Cocktail features a blend of gin, vermouth, and absinthe in a spirited honoring of funerary tradition rooted in New Orleans’ clandestine history of “secret societies, second-line parades, and celebrations of deathly holidays like Halloween and All Saints’ Day.”

Café Brûlot exemplifies New Orleans’ love for the dramatic with a theatrical presentation that holds as much weight as the libation itself. A concoction of coffee, brandy, sugar, cinnamon, lemon, oranges, cloves and sometimes an orange liqueur, the cocktail is served in a special Brûlot cup and set aflame in a highly ceremonial preparation that requires its own specialty tools and expertise. Born of legend and enduring through the centuries, the old-line restaurants of New Orleans — Antoine’s, Arnaud’s, Brennan’s, Broussard’s, Commander’s Palace and Galatoire’s — continue the tradition of this “devilishly incendiary coffee,” also known as Café Brûlot Diabolique.

This special “Crafted” edition of NEAT’s weekly Wine & Song event is complimentary and open to the public with live music and opportunities to purchase The Obituary Cocktail and the Café Brûlot cocktail after the demonstration. Strahan’s books on these legendary cocktails and the New Orleans history and cultural insights around them will be available for purchase, with a book signing from 5-7PM.

pages.title: Pickleball & Picklebacks | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Pickleball & Picklebacks | CRAFTED # Pickleball & Picklebacks ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Sunday, November 16, 2025 ### 12 - 3 PM ### Racquet Courts at ZUMA Join fellow spectators at the 2nd Annual Pickleball & Picklebacks event, held at ZUMA Wellness Center on Sunday, November 16th from 12-3 pm with 8 teams of two participating in the pickleball tournament. As the finale for Alys Beach Crafted’s week of events, Pickleball & Picklebacks will feature an expansive brunch spread from Alys Beach Culinary in addition to pickle inspired cocktails and, of course, the namesake pickleback (traditionally a shot of neat whiskey chased with a shot of pickle brine). A full bar will be available, as well. Please note, if interested in participating in the pickleball tournament, a pickleball team is a separate cost. IMPORTANT INFO Where ZUMA Wellness Center Racquet Courts When Sunday, November 16, 2025 | 12-3PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Sporty Casual Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors Music Sunshine Wranglers Band Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Spirited Soirée | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Spirited Soirée | CRAFTED # Spirited Soirée ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Saturday, November 15, 2025 ### 1 PM - 4 PM ### North Sea Garden Walk Spirited Soirée features an extensive gallery of cocktails crafted collaboratively in the pairing of specially selected mixologists and small-batch craft distilleries. On Saturday, November 15, 2025, from 1-4 pm, guests will have the opportunity to taste both the neat spirits and the crafted cocktail as each mixologist-distillery team reveals insights into the process and inspiration behind their creations. Enjoy specialty canapés, light bites, and desserts from the best culinary teams in the Southeast as you explore the vast collection of hand-crafted cocktails and spirits, and take home some of the new concepts, trends, and products currently setting the beverage world a-buzz. IMPORTANT INFO Where North Sea Garden Walk (Entrance of Pedestrian Path is on the north side of 30A between the Alys Beach Sales Center & Fonville Press along West La Garza Lane) When Saturday, November 15, 2025 | 1-4PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Soirée Chic, Flat shoes recommended Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Walkabout Music Chris Alvarado Duo Ken & Andi Johnson Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Holiday Makers Market Friday | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Holiday Makers Market Friday | CRAFTED # Holiday Makers Market ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Friday, November 14, 2025 ### 2 - 4:30 PM ### Alys Beach Amphitheatre Join us in the Alys Beach Amphitheatre on Friday, November 14, 2025 from 2 - 4:30 pm, Saturday, November 15 from 10 am - 2 pm and Sunday, November 16 from 10 am - 2 pm for the Alys Beach Crafted Holiday Makers Market. This collection of thoughtfully selected artisans will showcase their craft, their inspiration, and their stories with product representing the best in regional workmanship. Guests are invited to stroll through the Amphitheatre in Alys Beach Town Center to peruse the works of these makers, available to purchase and specially curated as gifts for loved ones, for the home, or for oneself, will be available for purchase as folks shop through the Amphitheatre in pursuit of beautifully curated gifts for their loved ones in preparation for the upcoming holidays. Enjoy live music while perusing the Makers Market and enjoy a selection of treats and refreshments available for purchase from surrounding Merchants. Photos with Santa will be available at select times during the Holiday Makers Market. This event is free and open to the public. IMPORTANT INFO Where Alys Beach Town Center Amphitheatre When Friday, November 14, 2025 | 2-4:30PM Age All ages, and dogs, welcome Dress Code Come as you are! Food / Drink Food and drink available to purchase from Town Center Merchants Environment Outdoors, Walking Tour Music Emily Brooke Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: Firkin Fête  | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Firkin Fête | CRAFTED # Firkin Fête ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ### Friday, November 14, 2025 ### 6:30 - 9 PM ### Central Park Join us for our 5th Annual Firkin Fête on Friday, November 14, 2025 from 6:30-9 pm in Central Park. Firkin Fête features a unique tasting experience as we tap firkins of beer created by local and regional breweries. The firkins, each an 11-gallon keg, are unique in that no one, including the brewers themselves, can know what the final product will taste like until the firkins are tapped for the event. Firkin Fête will also feature the culinary creations of chefs from throughout the southeast and live music performances from powerhouse NOLA soul group, J & the Causeways . This festive evening is not to be missed! IMPORTANT INFO Where Central Park at Alys Beach When Friday, November 14, 2025 | 6:30-9PM Age 21 years of age and older Dress Code Casual, Flat shoes recommended Food / Drink All food and drink included Environment Outdoors, Walkabout Music J & the Causeways Event Advisories Event occurs rain or shine. ADDITIONAL FESTIVAL POLICIES Tickets are non-refundable and non-transferable between events. ADDITIONAL NOTICE NO PETS ALLOWED. ONLY SERVICE ANIMALS PERMITTED. Service animals are defined as dogs that are individually trained to do work or perform tasks for people with disabilities. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN

pages.title: FAQ | CRAFTED

h2: Where can I find information about each event?
Which nonprofit organization does Alys Beach Crafted benefit?
What does rain or shine mean?
What am I allowed to bring into the festival?

pages.content: Title: | CRAFTED # ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## How do I purchase tickets? ## Where do I park ## What do I wear? ## Where can I find information about each event? ## Which nonprofit organization does Alys Beach Crafted benefit? ## What does rain or shine mean? ## What am I allowed to bring into the festival? ## CRAFTED Tickets go on sale to Alys Beach Homeowners on August 14th, 2025 and to the public on September 2nd, 2025. Tickets can only be purchased online. Dependent on availability, some tickets may be sold at the door. Parking is available on-site at Alys Beach. The best location is the Amphitheatre, located at the corner of Hwy 30A and Somerset Street. Signs will direct traffic to additional parking areas. The festival is a casual affair. Ladies, flat shoes are recommended, as there is a lot of walking throughout the festival on cobblestone pathways and lawn spaces. And, don’t forget your best pickleball ‘fit for Sunday’s Pickleball & Picklebacks event! The schedule page has all the information regarding each event. The Cultural Arts Alliance Every effort will be made for the festival to go on despite inclement weather (i.e., rain, storms, etc.) within reason. If extreme weather, such as high winds or a hurricane, poses threat to our guests or equipment, then the event will not move forward and tickets will be refunded if a mandatory evacuation is in place. Purses and bags are permitted and will be checked upon entry. Alcohol, chairs, weapons, and firearms are not permissible. Cameras are permitted for personal/non-commercial use only. For professional photography and video use, prior approval is required. Please contact events@alysbeach.com for advance approval. Ticketed events are 21+ with the exception of the Be the Maker Workshops. Pets & strollers are not permitted at ticketed events; they are welcome in the Alys Beach Amphitheatre at the Holiday Makers Market. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
original_paragraphs: Tickets go on sale to Alys Beach Homeowners on August 14th, 2025 and to the public on September 2nd, 2025. Tickets can only be purchased online. Dependent on availability, some tickets may be sold at the door.
Parking is available on-site at Alys Beach. The best location is the Amphitheatre, located at the corner of Hwy 30A and Somerset Street. Signs will direct traffic to additional parking areas.

The festival is a casual affair. Ladies, flat shoes are recommended, as there is a lot of walking throughout the festival on cobblestone pathways and lawn spaces. And, don’t forget your best pickleball ‘fit for Sunday’s Pickleball & Picklebacks event!
The schedule page has all the information regarding each event.

Every effort will be made for the festival to go on despite inclement weather (i.e., rain, storms, etc.) within reason. If extreme weather, such as high winds or a hurricane, poses threat to our guests or equipment, then the event will not move forward and tickets will be refunded if a mandatory evacuation is in place.

Purses and bags are permitted and will be checked upon entry. Alcohol, chairs, weapons, and firearms are not permissible. Cameras are permitted for personal/non-commercial use only. For professional photography and video use, prior approval is required. Please contact

for advance approval. Ticketed events are 21+ with the exception of the Be the Maker Workshops. Pets & strollers are not permitted at ticketed events; they are welcome in the Alys Beach Amphitheatre at the Holiday Makers Market.

pages.title: Cultural Arts Alliance | CRAFTED
pages.content: Title: Cultural Arts Alliance | CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## Supporting the Arts ## CRAFTED The Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County has been the creative core of the local community for three decades – 30 years of fostering creativity as a local arts agency in Walton County, Florida. Supporting the arts through leadership, advocacy, funding, programs, and education, the CAA’s mission is to encourage and promote creativity. With an emphasis on inclusivity and collaboration, the CAA provides opportunities for residents and visitors to experience diverse forms of art and learning, connecting them to broad, critical explorations through artistic expression and engagement. ​ The Alys Foundation and Alys Beach are committed to providing cultural experiences for the broader Alys Beach Community, including creative programming, a permanent collection of art works displayed throughout the town’s landscape, and through partnerships with organizations like the Cultural Arts Alliance. Alys Beach Crafted is delighted to support the CAA while sharing the stories that craft tells. Website Design by INFLUENCE OCEAN
original_paragraphs: The Cultural Arts Alliance of Walton County has been the creative core of the local community for three decades – 30 years of fostering creativity as a local arts agency in Walton County, Florida. Supporting the arts through leadership, advocacy, funding, programs, and education, the CAA’s mission is to encourage and promote creativity. With an emphasis on inclusivity and collaboration, the CAA provides opportunities for residents and visitors to experience diverse forms of art and learning, connecting them to broad, critical explorations through artistic expression and engagement.

The Alys Foundation and Alys Beach are committed to providing cultural experiences for the broader Alys Beach Community, including creative programming, a permanent collection of art works displayed throughout the town’s landscape, and through partnerships with organizations like the Cultural Arts Alliance. Alys Beach Crafted is delighted to support the CAA while sharing the stories that craft tells.

pages.title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets
pages.meta_description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight.

h2: Celebrating the stories that craft tells.

pages.content: Title: CRAFTED | A Multi‑Day Celebration of Culinary Creativity, Tastings & Makers Markets Description: Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## CRAFTED ## Celebrating the stories that craft tells. ## November 12–16, 2025 | Alys Beach, Florida ## A Weekend to Savor ## Signature Experiences ## Schedule ## With Gratitude to Our Sponsors ## Supporting the Arts ## CRAFTED ### Firkin Fête ### Holiday Makers Market ### Spirited Soirée ### Pickleball & Picklebacks Crafted invites you into a multi-day journey of culinary expression, spirited tastings, and hands-on discovery. From elegant soirées to inspired makers markets, each event celebrates the creativity of chefs, distillers, designers, and craftspeople from across the country. Whether you’re savoring a firkin-poured ale or discovering handmade wares, every moment is designed to delight. From lively tastings to thoughtful markets, Crafted offers a collection of unforgettable gatherings. Explore these featured events and discover your favorites. An intimate tasting event featuring rare firkin cask ales, craft brews, and paired bites from local chefs. A curated marketplace of handmade goods, fine crafts, and seasonal gifts from talented artisans. An elevated afternoon of cocktails, live music, and culinary delights along the scenic Pedestrian Path at Alys Beach. A playful morning of friendly competition and briny refreshment—yes, pickleback shots included. Plan your perfect weekend. Whether you're sipping rare spirits, browsing handmade goods, or enjoying the delightful afternoon soiree, each day of Crafted is thoughtfully designed to inspire, delight, and connect.
